naturalClock.title: Natural Clock
naturalClock.description:
I'm a clock inspired by nature.
My only hand completes just one rotation daily...
Tracking the sun's path across the sky,
seamlessly... on a 360° dial.

thirteenMoons.title: 13 Moons Spiral
thirteenMoons.description:
Drawing from global traditions,
my 13 months with 28 days each
replaces our conventional calendar.
The year concludes with the Rainbow Day.

hero.description:
Natural Time reimagines how we measure time.
Through the {clock} and the {spiral},
the sun reclaims its role as the universal reference point
for the passage of time...

understanding.title: Understanding
understanding.subtitle: natural time
understanding.mission:
I am a time measurement system
Crafted to replace (or complement)
the 24-hour clock
and the Gregorian calendar.

closing.line1: We created machines to measure time.
closing.line2: Then we became slaves to their ticking.
closing.line4: Nature has already given us the perfect timekeeper...
closing.line5: The sun! The ultimate orchestrator of all living things.

meta.title: Natural Time - A new way to measure time, inspired by nature

welcome.description: Discover a simpler, more intuitive way to track the passage of time throughout the day

notification.title: Natural Clock Tutorial
notification.message: Welcome! This visual guide explains how the 360° natural clock works in the blink of an eye

step1.title: I am a natural clock
step1.description: I constantly point to the sun's position

step2.title: My single hand
step2.description: Makes just one complete rotation per day, very slowly

step4.title: 180° marks true noon
step4.description: When the sun is at its highest in the sky

step5.title: 0° indicates the middle of the night
step5.description: When the sun is on the opposite side of our position

step6.title: The mustaches represent day and night
step6.description: Day/night duration varies with season and latitude

step11.title: On equinox days only
step11.description: Day and night are exactly equal in length

step12.title: We no longer ask "What time is it?"
step12.description: But "Where is the sun in the sky?"

step14.title: The numbers are optional
step14.description: The natural clock is primarily a visual experience

end.title: Tutorial completed!
end.description: To continue, the app needs a geographic location

welcome.description: Discover the 13 Moons Spiral, a universal calendar entirely based on natural cycles

notification.title: 13 Moons Tutorial
notification.message: Welcome! This visual guide explains how the 13 moons calendar works in the blink of an eye

step1.title: I am a calendar with 13 months of 28 days

step3.title: Each day is named after a color

step4.title: Then Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo

step5.title: The 13 moons are arranged in a spiral
step5.description: Because time is cyclical, not linear

step6.title: Here is the 5th day of the 5th moon

step7.title: And here: the 11th day of the 11th moon
step7.description: A green day, regardless of the year or century

step8.title: Did you know? 13 × 28 = 364 days 🤩
step8.description: Let's add one more day to reach 365

step9.title: This is the Rainbow Day 🌈
step9.description: A celebration day around the winter solstice (northern hemisphere)

step10.title: Some years have 366 days
step10.description: A chance to celebrate two consecutive days out of time

step11.title: A natural date is written: YEAR ) MOON ) DAY
step11.description: A format that allows alphabetical sorting

step13.title: Important note
step13.description: The 28 days differ from the lunar cycle of 29.53 days (see FAQ)

end.title: Tutorial completed!
end.description: To continue, the app needs a geographic location
